column4: What would be the best RAID chunk size for an Ubuntu i386 32 bit desktop system?
I'm hoping to do some video editing with it
my max chunk/slice size available is 512k
you want smaller chunks for video editing
uh oes.
how small?
8kb or less
wow
read the article yourself
to spread the write process out?
http://www.zdnet.com/blog/storage/chunks-the-hidden-key-to-raid-performance/130
large I/O requests benefit from smaller chunks
thanks
aw man, I'm going to have to reformat my drive if I change the chunk size, aren't I?
yep
(best Cartman impression) Weak....
thanks fo the help
I guess it would make sense to make the chunk size match the block size of the file system, no?
yeah certain os's wont recognize the raid device with too small of a chunk size. Ubuntu wouldn't recognize less than 1k, windows 4k
still well within the recommended limits for video editing
again thanks for the heads up on that article
